title: Cat. 75.2  Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary), 1894/95, published Mar. 1895
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary)  
1894/95, published Mar. 1895  
Transfer zincograph on coarse-grained transfer paper, in dark-blue ink on thin ivory wove paper (an imitation Japanese vellum); 380 × 282 mm  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.263  
Guérin 51, Kornfeld 27 C  
For the verso, see fig. 75.2.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Sold by Paul Prouté, Paris, to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, for Edward McCormick Blair (1915–2010), Chicago, Apr. 1983, lot 161.

Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Bar Harbor, Maine, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, College of the Atlantic, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, Aug. 10–Sept. 11, 1999, cat. 28.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, Sept. 6, 2003–Jan. 11, 2004, cat. 40.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 130, cat. 27.

Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, From Paradise to Eden: Gauguin in Tahiti, exh. cat. (College of the Atlantic, Ethel H. Blum Gallery, 1999), p. 10, cat. 28.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 40.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Stamped upper right, in black ink: 92

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, invoice, Apr. 18, 1983, to Edward Blair, Sr., curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago. The work was sold at auction: Chez Paul Prouté, S.A., Paris, Estampes originales: De maîtres des XIXè et XXè siècles, catalogue “Signac”, sale cat. (Chez Paul Prouté, 1983), p. 69, lot 161 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 75.2 Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary), 1894/95, published Mar. 1895.

fig. 75.2.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Ia orana Maria (Hail Mary) (1894/95). The Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.263.

</section>
